dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, big news coming out of Kazakhstan today, B. President Tokayev, he's actually touched down in the Aktobe region.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, big news coming out of Kazakhstan today, B. President Tokayev, he's actually touched down in the Aktobe region.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev has arrived in the Aktobe region.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, really? [overlaps] Okay, so what's, like, the occasion? Is he just touring, or...?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, really? Okay, so what's, like, the occasion? Is he just touring, or...?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No, no, he's actually there for something pretty significant. He's participating in this international military-patriotic youth gathering called "Aibyn."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, no, he's actually there for something pretty significant. He's participating in this international military-patriotic youth gathering called Aibyn.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the presidential press service, Tokayev will take part in the international military-patriotic youth gathering "Aibyn" held in the city of Aktobe.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Aibyn, huh? That sounds... interesting. So, like, a big youth camp, basically?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Aibyn, huh? That sounds... interesting. So, like, a big youth camp, basically?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, pretty much! It's happening right now, actually, from June 23rd to the 28th, at this military institute there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, pretty much! It's happening right now, actually, from June twenty third to the twenty eighth, at this military institute there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The gathering is taking place from June 23 to 28 in a field camp of the Talgat Bigeldinov Military Institute of the Air Defence Forces.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. And I heard, uh, it's not just Kazakhstani kids, right? It's international?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. And I heard, uh, it's not just Kazakhstani kids, right? It's international?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. They've got over 50 teams, you know, from Kazakhstan itself, but also Azerbaijan, Belarus, Kyrgyzstan, Russia, and Uzbekistan. And these are, like, young people, 14 to 18 years old.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. They've got over fifty teams, you know, from Kazakhstan itself, but also Azerbaijan, Belarus, Kyrgyzstan, Russia, and Uzbekistan. And these are, like, young people, fourteen to eighteen years old.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: More than 50 teams from Kazakhstan, Azerbaijan, Belarus, Kyrgyzstan, Russia, and Uzbekistan have arrived. The participants are aged 14 to 18.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's quite a crowd! And, um, what's it all about, really? Besides, like, the military aspect?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's quite a crowd! And, um, what's it all about, really? Besides, like, the military aspect?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it's actually dedicated to two really important anniversaries. The 100th of Hero of the Soviet Union Aliya Moldagulova, who's from that region, and also the 80th anniversary of Victory in the Great Patriotic War.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it's actually dedicated to two really important anniversaries. The one hundredth of Hero of the Soviet Union Aliya Moldagulova, who's from that region, and also the eightieth anniversary of Victory in the Great Patriotic War.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This event is dedicated to the 100th anniversary of Hero of the Soviet Union Aliya Moldagulova, who was born in this region, and to the 80th anniversary of Victory in the Great Patriotic War.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, so a lot of shared history there. [overlaps] It's like uniting the youth, I guess, through that common past.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, so a lot of shared history there. It's like uniting the youth, I guess, through that common past.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And they're doing all sorts of stuff. Military-style cross-country races, relays, even an intellectual game called 'Aibyn Daryny.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And they're doing all sorts of stuff. Military-style cross-country races, relays, even an intellectual game called Aibyn Daryny.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The gathering aims to unite our youth, help them get to know each other and their shared history, and includes military and sports activities such as a military-style cross-country race, relay, the intellectual game ˜Aibyn Daryny™, and more.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, cool. So it's not just, like, drills and stuff. [overlaps] There's actual, uh, you know, mental challenges too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, cool. So it's not just, like, drills and stuff. There's actual, uh, you know, mental challenges too.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, definitely. And get this, they're all living in tents, but apparently, they've got all the necessary conditions, including, uh, four meals a day!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, definitely. And get this, they're all living in tents, but apparently, they've got all the necessary conditions, including, uh, four meals a day!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Participants live in tents, with all necessary conditions provided, including four meals a day, said Daulet Beisekov, an officer from the headquarters organizing "Aibyn-2025".

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Four meals? Okay, that's better than my college dorm! [chuckles] Sounds like a pretty well-organized event, all things considered.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Four meals? Okay, that's better than my college dorm! Sounds like a pretty well-organized event, all things considered.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really does. It's, um, about fostering that sense of unity and shared heritage, I think.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really does. It's, um, about fostering that sense of unity and shared heritage, I think.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, definitely. And, you know, Tokayev was just there back in December, too, right? For industrial stuff. So, he's, uh, pretty hands-on with Aktobe it seems.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, definitely. And, you know, Tokayev was just there back in December, too, right? For industrial stuff. So, he's, uh, pretty hands-on with Aktobe it seems.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Note: President Tokayev last visited the Aktobe region in December 2024 during a working trip, where he was shown several industrial enterprises and introduced to the operations of local social facilities.
